Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the idea that students are not allowed to pray or discuss the mass shooting in El Paso when they go to school.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support to prove that students are not allowed to pray or bring up the shooting in schools.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that students are not allowed to pray or discuss the shooting in schools based on the Lt. Gov.'s statement, which is proven to be false.
Exist alternative explanation: There is an alternative explanation to the claim, as students are actually allowed to pray in schools and discuss current events, including mass shootings.
